qas.question: What is the mother church of the Angican Communion?
Which church in the United States is associated with the Angican Communion?
What practice differentiates the Angican Communon from Protestant churches at large?
What branch of Christianity does the Angican Communion fall under?
Who founded the universal authority within the mother church (the Church of England)?
Which church in the United States did Mary give universal authority to?
How many churches formed the Marian doctrines?
Which church is both "catholic" and "Reformed", but also Protestant?

context: The <b6_0>multiple churches<b6_0/> that form the Anglican Communion and the Continuing Anglican movement have different views on Marian doctrines and venerative practices given that there is no single church with universal authority within the Communion and that the mother church (<a0_0><b7_0>the Church of England<b7_0/><a0_0/>) understands itself to be both "catholic" and "Reformed". Thus unlike the <a3_0>Protestant<a3_0/> churches at large, the Anglican Communion (which includes <a1_0><b5_0>the Episcopal Church<b5_0/><a1_0/> in the United States) includes segments which still retain some <a2_0>veneration of <b4_0>Mary<b4_0/><a2_0/>.
